Name: Limiting the days that alternate side of the street parking is in effect in residentially zoned districts.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting the days that alternate side of the street parking is in effect in residentially zoned districts.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.  Subchapter 2 of chapter one of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-163.2 to read as follows:
§19-163.2  Limitations on alternate side of the street parking days.  Alternate side of the street parking regulations shall be in effect no more than two days per week in any zoning district designated as residential under the New York city zoning resolution; provided, however, that this section shall not apply to any street with a roadway width greater than thirty feet or on any street where meters regulate parking on such street.
§2.  This local law shall take effect thirty days after it is enacted into law.
